sense.name: cause to pale, weak, stunt the growth of
sense.commentary: Note: this sense does NOT apply to the weakening, bleaching of plants. Syntax includes: NP1[patient] ETIOLATE NP1[agent] ETIOLATE NP2[patient]
sense.examples: The smoke etiolated her complexion. The long illness etiolated him beyond recognition. An artificial glow etiolated him into a hopeless pale yellow.

sense.name: bleach, alter the growth of a plant by depriving sunlight
sense.commentary:
Note: this sense does not apply to the weakening of things other than plants.
Syntax includes: NP1[patient] ETIOLATE NP1[agent] ETIOLATE NP2[patient]
sense.examples: My seedlings,in lack of light,etiolated a bit. They etiolated somewhat and lost their lower leaves. In one of his experiments he etiolated a vine shoot.
